item.title: History and Hauntings of Salem Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Learn about Salem’s mysterious past on this guided walking tour of the city. Follow your historian guide through Salem, listening to 400 years of history, and admire the old architecture that dates back to the early colonial period. Find out the truth about the 1692 Salem Witch Trial hysteria, which has influenced literature and pop culture. For a spookier experience, select the nighttime tour led by lantern light.

image.alt: History and Hauntings of Salem Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Whale Watching Tour in Gloucester
item.description: Experience one of the best whale-sighting destinations in the world on this guided, 4-hour whale-watching cruise around the Stellwagen Bank National Marine Sanctuary. Hop on a high-speed catamaran that gets to and from the whales in the least amount of time possible. See humpback and fin whales, plus Atlantic white-sided dolphins and harbour porpoises with the help of a naturalist guide. The on-board galley offers hot meals, snacks and beverages for purchase during the trip.

image.alt: Whale Watching Tour in Gloucester

item.title: Boston: Freedom Trail Small Group Walking History Tour
item.description: Take a deep dive into the history of the American Revolution on this walking tour of Boston. Your historian guide will focus on the years between 1760 and 1775, a tumultuous time with plenty to talk about. Stroll the Freedom Trail and ask questions along the way; your small group will make for an intimate atmosphere.

image.alt: Boston: Freedom Trail Small Group Walking History Tour

item.title: The Salem Night Ghost Tour
item.description: When night falls across Salem, it's the perfect time to explore the city’s spooky and sinister past on a haunted history tour. On this top-rated walk through one of America's most haunted places, follow a licensed guide along lamplit streets while listening to legends and true tales of witchcraft, murder, mayhem, and more. Visit sites related to the infamous 17th-century Salem Witch Trials, and hear about the ghostly spirits said to still rattle through the town’s historic homes and graveyards.

image.alt: The Salem Night Ghost Tour

item.title: Harvard University Campus Guided Walking Tour
item.description: For anyone thinking of attending Harvard, or for those who simply want a glimpse of college life at the famous university, this tour is a must. Get an exclusive account from current Harvard students, who provide key insights into the life and times at Cambridge with a theatrical, humorous flair. Check out the old buildings at Harvard Yard and Harvard Square and learn about the school’s storied past. Illustrated map of Harvard Square included. Choose from several departure times throughout the day.

image.alt: Harvard University Campus Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Tour of Historic Fenway Park, America's Most Beloved Ballpark
item.description: Revel in the history of Fenway Park, one of baseball’s most beloved stadiums, during this guided tour. Revisit the careers of Red Sox greats like Ted Williams, Babe Ruth, and Carl Yastrzemski, celebrate the club’s numerous World Series titles, and tour famous stadium locales like the ‘Green Monster,’ ‘Pesky’s Pole,’ and the Fenway Park Living Museum.

image.alt: Tour of Historic Fenway Park, America's Most Beloved Ballpark

item.title: Boston Tea Party Ships & Museum Admission
item.description: Relive the most important event leading up to the American Revolution on this guided tour of the Boston Tea Party Ships and Museum. Take a journey back in time to the famous Boston Tea Party, an incident that changed the course of American history. It’s more than a stroll through historic artifacts, though. It’s truly one of the top-rated museums in the city of Boston. Explore authentically restored tea ships and throw the fated tea into Boston Harbor.

image.alt: Boston Tea Party Ships & Museum Admission

item.title: Boston's Best Freedom Trail Tour
item.description: Walk the Freedom Trail with a guide in historic costume on a tour from Boston Common to Faneuil Hall, a 1.2-mile route that covers important sites in the heart of Boston. This tour's shorter distance lets you follow in the footsteps of the founding fathers and American revolutionaries without making the more strenuous trek all the way across the Charles River, finishing in a spot that’s convenient to top Boston attractions.

image.alt: Boston's Best Freedom Trail Tour

item.title: Whale Watching Trips to Stellwagen Bank Marine Sanctuary. Guaranteed sightings!
item.description: Get the best chance of seeing whales off the coast of Gloucester, Massachusetts, by booking this half-day whale-watch cruise. Your experienced captain and crew know the whales’ feeding and swimming patterns and keep close tabs on where they’re hanging out. Spread out on the deck of the boat and enjoy being out in the open air while you find whales, then get ready to snap photos of breaching, spouts, and tail slaps.

image.alt: Whale Watching Trips to Stellwagen Bank Marine Sanctuary. Guaranteed sightings!

item.title: The Revolutionary Story Epic Small Group Walking Tour of Boston
item.description: Learn about Boston’s revolutionary history on a walking tour that emphasizes good storytelling. Enjoy personalized attention from your guide in your small group as you walk a curated route that includes the Freedom Trail. Visit well-known sites as well as more local places and develop an understanding of modern Boston along with its history.

image.alt: The Revolutionary Story Epic Small Group Walking Tour of Boston

item.title: Bewitched Walking Tour of Salem
item.description: Experience 400 years of history in just a few hours with this award-winning guided walking tour of America’s spookiest city: Salem. This tour takes you on an in-depth exploration of downtown, stopping at more than 12 historically significant locations to delve into the infamous Witch Trials. Local guides tell the stories of Salem’s witchy past with an entertaining mix of history, legend, and pop culture.

image.alt: Bewitched Walking Tour of Salem

item.title: Boston: North End to Freedom Trail - Food & History Walking Tour
item.description: Combine two attractions Boston has to offer—delicious food and rich history—on this 5 hour walking tour that starts in the popular North End and continues along the Freedom Trail. Snack your way through this historic Italian neighborhood, trying fresh bread at a hidden bakery and enjoying an Italian salumeria, tasting meats, cheeses, pastries, pizza and cappuccino. Once fortified, walk the Freedom Trail to discover the rich history and fascinating facts about the American Revolution and experience the modern city Boston is now.

image.alt: Boston: North End to Freedom Trail - Food & History Walking Tour

item.title: Satanic Salem Walking Tour
item.description:
Salem history from The Satanic Temple's Salem Art Gallery!
The most unique walking tour in Salem, free of supernatural or superstitious elements. No ghost stories.
Your tour guide is an expert in occultism, witchcraft, an ordained satanic minister.
Surprisingly very family friendly, but for weird families.
Who the hell is The Satanic Temple? Watch the documentary "Hail Satan?" before booking to learn more.

image.alt: Satanic Salem Walking Tour

item.title: Mysteries and Murders of Salem Guided Night-Time Walking Tour
item.description: This murder and mystery walking tour of Salem is a great option for travelers who want a break from hearing exclusively about the history of the Salem witch trials. Mix things up by listening to tales of grisly murders and sinister ghost sightings as your guide leads you to the spookiest sights in Salem. This tour is suitable for young adults and adults. Not suitable for small children.

image.alt: Mysteries and Murders of Salem Guided Night-Time Walking Tour

item.title: 3-Hour Martha's Vineyard Island Tour from Oak Bluffs
item.description: Visit Martha's Vineyard highlights on this half-day, small-group tour from Oak Bluffs. Make the most of your time on the island as you check out Oak Bluffs, Edgartown, and the Aquinnah Cliffs, learning stories about island history and cultures along the way. This Martha’s Vineyard tour is limited to 14 people for personal service from the local guide, and it includes a 15-minute break to explore the Aquinnah Cliffs.

image.alt: 3-Hour Martha's Vineyard Island Tour from Oak Bluffs

item.title: The Salem Witch Walk
item.description: Unlike other Salem walking tours, this witch walking tour is led by a practicing witch, so you can learn about the history of witchcraft, as well as how it’s practiced today. Walk through the streets of Salem and learn about the dos and don'ts of modern-day witchcraft, stopping at Salem's Old Burying Point Cemetery along the way.

image.alt: The Salem Witch Walk

item.title: Boston's North End Small Group Food Tour
item.description: Walking the cobblestone streets of the most popular neighborhood North End is a must, but don’t waste time looking for the ideal place to eat. Join other passionate foodies to snack your way through the neighborhood. Your guide directs you to a hidden, a generations-old bakery, an authentic Italian salumeria, and a family run pastry shop. Visit the Old North Church (or equivalent alternative) and maybe even get a chance to talk with the neighborhood’s best bakers. Pizza, pastries, and other delights round out your experience.

image.alt: Boston's North End Small Group Food Tour

item.title: Public Small Group Walking Tour of the Full Boston Freedom Trail
item.description: Discover the thrilling history of Boston on this immersive walking tour of the Freedom Trail. Hear tales of Redcoats, smugglers, riots, and midnight riders while reliving the American Revolution as you explore all 16 official sites of the trail. Learn about Boston’s leadership in abolition, women’s rights, education, and immigration over its 400-year history. Explore downtown Boston, hearing stories of legendary figures like Paul Revere, John Hancock, and lesser-known pioneers and patriots.

image.alt: Public Small Group Walking Tour of the Full Boston Freedom Trail

item.title: Boston Small-Group Walking Food Tour With Tastings
item.description: Sample some of the most delicious bites that Boston’s North End has to offer—and enjoy a personalized, first-hand introduction to the area’s charms and Italian heritage—on this small-group walking tour. Choose between several convenient start times, and be sure to bring your appetite: you’ll follow your guide to a number of local businesses, where you’ll try everything from clam chowder and lobster rolls to pasta and cannoli. At the end, you'll enjoy a delicious Secret Dish, that will be revealed only on the day of the tour.

image.alt: Boston Small-Group Walking Food Tour With Tastings

item.title: Boston's North End Pizza & History Walking Food Tour
item.description: Enjoy some of the best pizza in Boston on this walking food tour. Stroll through the city’s oldest neighborhoods, including, appropriately, Little Italy on the North End. Walk along the Freedom Trail that leads to 16 historically significant sites, like Paul Revere House, Old North Church, and the USS ‘Constitution,’ to name a few. Visit some of Boston's best pizzerias and enjoy a slice at each. It’s a fun and flavorful way to get to know Boston.

image.alt: Boston's North End Pizza & History Walking Food Tour

item.title: Guided Freedom Trail Walking Tour
item.description: Travel back in time to colonial New England on a historic walking tour. Your costumed and in-character guide gives you an immersive understanding of life during America’s infancy. Hear exclusive stories about the country’s Founding Fathers and discover iconic historical sites on this tour that covers approximately 1.2 miles (two kilometers).

image.alt: Guided Freedom Trail Walking Tour

item.title: 2.5-Hour Salem History & Sightseeing Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Salem, Massachusetts, is known for the infamous witch trials, but that isn’t the only historical occurrence you’ll learn about during this guided walking tour. Join a guide for a deep dive into the long history of Salem from the Puritans and Patriots to the present day. You’ll stop by city landmarks including the Salem Witch Trials Memorial, the Pickering House, and the Ropes Mansion and Gardens. This tour is wheelchair and stroller accessible.

image.alt: 2.5-Hour Salem History & Sightseeing Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Boston Delicious Donut Adventure by Underground Donut Tour
item.description: Boston is famous for its donuts and has numerous artisanal donut stores, some hidden away from its tourist areas. Instead of hunting them down independently, let a guide lead you there and introduce you to some top donut varieties, enabling you to try flavors and gain insight into the local donut scene you might otherwise miss. Between tastings, browse a market, eat a delicious bakery treat and explore historical neighborhoods such as North End before one final, scrumptious donut sampling.

image.alt: Boston Delicious Donut Adventure by Underground Donut Tour

item.title: Boston Small-Group Freedom Trail History Tour Pub Crawl
item.description: Discover the best of Boston’s hops and history on a pub crawl. Offered at three separate times, you can easily find start at a time that fits with your schedule. Select the Happy Hour tour and enjoy four draught beers or ciders. Or choose the Dry Run option and purchase drinks as you please. Either way, visit some of the city’s top pubs with your guide while passing iconic historical sites.

image.alt: Boston Small-Group Freedom Trail History Tour Pub Crawl
